metadata.name: Permafrost Dreams
metadata.description:
"Why me?"
Often this thought
simmers up your spine
on freshly baked mornings 
of dew, and
succulent late nights 
curled in sunspots.

Take my hand
entwine your fingers with mine
such that we are welded by the light
shed from a shooting star
and suddenly
the beat of your heartbeat increases
"Why?"
That is the question you must ask
for there is no me
any longer."

-

Permafrost Dreams is a visual depiction of a poem written by me in 2016. It was completed over a period of a week from start to finish.

Technical details - 
Hand-drawn on A3 Canson Paper with Unipin fineliners
Dimensions: 1997 x 2965 p

Offers - 
The buyer will receive the original hand-drawn artwork, delivered to them via international courier.
